Package com.purnendu.quizo.dao

Interface UserDao

public interface UserDao
This interface handles the data access object (DAO) for user-related operations, including managing User and Attempt data. It leverages Room Persistence Library annotations such as Dao, Insert, Update, Query, Transaction, and uses standard Java collections like List. It also specifies conflict resolution strategies via OnConflictStrategy.
Version:
2.0.1
Author:
Purnendu Guha

  • Method Details

    • insertUser

      void insertUser(User user)
      Inserts a new User into the database. If a user with the same primary key (email) already exists, a SQLiteConstraintException will be thrown unless an OnConflictStrategy is specified.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object to insert.

    • insertAttempt

      void insertAttempt(Attempt attempt)
      Inserts a new Attempt record into the database. If an attempt with the same primary key (createdTimeAttempt) already exists, the existing attempt will be replaced with the new one.
      Parameters:
      attempt - The Attempt object to insert.

    • updateUser

      void updateUser(User user)
      Updates an existing User record in the database. The update is based on the primary key (email) of the provided User object.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object to update.

    • observeAllUser

      List<User> observeAllUser()
      Retrieves all User records from the 'user' table.
      Returns:
      A List of all User objects.

    • getUserAndAttemptsWithSameEmail

      List<Attempt> getUserAndAttemptsWithSameEmail(String email)
      Retrieves all Attempt records associated with a specific user email. This query uses a Transaction to ensure atomicity if multiple database operations were involved (though for a single SELECT, it's primarily for clarity).
      Parameters:
      email - The email address of the user whose attempts are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A List of Attempt objects.

    • getOverAllPoints

      long getOverAllPoints(String email)
      Calculates the sum of 'earned' points from all Attempt records for a specific user email. This query uses a Transaction to ensure atomicity.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address of the user whose total points are to be calculated.
      Returns:
      The sum of earned points for the specified user, or 0 if no attempts are found.
